channel.title: Max hit calc
channel.description: Does anyone know how to add a Max hit calc or a damage system into Bakatool's v.5 source? If you do id appreciate if someone gave me the code.

item.title: Max hit calc
item.dc:creator: @sitapea sitapea
item.description:
@sitapea wrote:

Ah yes. That message thing might be good idea, since I don’t know how to edit client.

But what you mean work against each others? Currently I made something like when you have attack 1, opponent has def 1, then chance of hitting is 50%, when he has def 2, then chance of hitting is 100 / (2+1) = 33%, when he has def 99, then chance of hiting is 100 / (99 + 1) = 1%, when you have attack 50 and opponent has def 30, then hit chance is (100 / (50+30)) * 50 = 62.5%

I’m not sure if that formula is right, but I’m using it…

So, the formula I use is “(100 / (defence + attack)) * attack” - that should return the chance of hiting your opponent. And with Geminus source you can use this: if((Math.random() * 100) <= (100 / (defence + attack)) * attack) { attack the damn monster }

Read full topic

item.title: Max hit calc
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

[quote=“sitapea, post:3, topic:173971”]Anything about defense or attack formulas?

EDIT: off topic Also does anyone know how to see in-game player coordinates while playing? It would make my life alot more easier while spawning NPCs.[/quote]

defense and attack work against each other thats the formula

to see player coordinates either edit your client’s mudclient to draw string on screen based on adding

sectionX + areaX to get X and sectionY+areaY to get Y

or make a command in server to send Message of your currentX and currentY coordinates or just make it spam console out’s with currentX,Y when you move.

Read full topic

item.title: Max hit calc
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

If you’re asking how to code a max hit system, that would come under guideline #4 of ‘stuff not to do in this board’.
if you’re asking for a max hit formula:

Math.ceil((strengthModifiers * strengthLevel) * ((wepPower * 0.00175) + 0.1) + 1.05)

Where Math.ceil is the function for rounding a number up and strengthModifiers is a decimal value representing your increase from prayer (e.g. 1.05 for burst of strength).

Read full topic
